tokens.name: AAVE
tokens.description: Aave is a decentralized lending protocol with a multi-role access control system. AAVE token has fixed supply (no mint function) behind an upgradeable proxy controlled by governance. Protocol revenue flows programmatically to a governance-controlled treasury. The protocol demonstrates strong governance controls with granular role separation and emergency powers limited to pause-only operations.
tokens.infoDescription: Aave implements a governance-controlled lending protocol where AAVE token holders benefit from a fixed supply guarantee (no mint function exists). Protocol revenue flows programmatically to a governance-controlled treasury with indirect value accrual to token holders.

tokens.name: AERO
tokens.description: Aerodrome is a ve(3,3) AMM protocol on Base with largely immutable contracts and programmatic value flows. The protocol demonstrates strong decentralization characteristics with limited admin controls and no critical backdoors. Trading fees flow directly to liquidity providers and voters, not to a protocol treasury. The main revenue for the team comes from a capped 5% emission allocation.
tokens.infoDescription: Aerodrome Finance is a next-generation AMM designed to serve as Base's central liquidity hub. veAERO holders benefit from anti-dilution rebasing, aligned emissions, and a gauge system that enforces incentives directly in contracts with 100% of fees flowing to token stakers.

tokens.name: CRV
tokens.description: Curve's veCRV + gauge system is the canonical example of programmatic, onchain value direction by tokenholders. Emissions, incentives, and economic power are enforced directly in contracts, not by discretionary intermediaries.
tokens.infoDescription: Curve Finance pioneered the ve(3,3) model with veCRV gauge voting. The protocol's offchain structure shows no tokenholder-representing entity; Swiss Stake AG controls the interface and trademark, creating a misalignment between onchain governance and offchain control.

tokens.name: LDO
tokens.description: Lido is a liquid staking protocol governed by LDO holders through on-chain voting, safeguarded by stETH holders via Dual Governance. The LDO token contract is immutable but has a controller with mint/burn capabilities. The token has unbounded supply due to mint functionality, but minting requires LDO holder majority approval.
tokens.infoDescription: Lido stands out for having real onchain ownership over core protocol contracts, with LDO holders exercising enforceable control through a multi-step governance flow with stETH holder veto protection via Dual Governance. Main risk is unbounded token supply.

tokens.name: UNI
tokens.description: The UNI token is a non-upgradeable ERC20 with algorithmic inflation controls (max 2% per year, hardcoded). Protocol fees across all versions are governed by UNI token holders through on-chain governance votes. UNI is primarily a governance token with no programmatic value accrual at the token level, but governance votes can direct protocol revenue to holders.
tokens.infoDescription: Uniswap's combination of onchain governance (including the fee switch) and the DUNI legal structure reflects commitment to aligning protocol control with tokenholder authority. Core contracts are immutable with hardcoded inflation cap and governance-controlled fee routing.
